title: Air Fryer Chicken Katsu with Homemade Katsu Sauce Recipe
description: Air fryer chicken katsu with homemade sauce is a quick and easy dish — perfectly crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside, and delicious.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Japanese Air Fryer Chicken Katsu with Homemade Katsu Sauce 4.4 (41) 38 Reviews 7 Photos Air fryer chicken katsu that is crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. The sauce is a little bit sweet, a little bit tangy, and complements the chicken perfectly. Serve over rice if desired. Submitted by Soup Loving Nicole Updated on November 15, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings Katsu Sauce: ½ cup ketchup 2 tablespoons soy sauce 1 tablespoon brown sugar 1 tablespoon sherry 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce 1 teaspoon minced garlic Chicken: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast, sliced in half horizontally 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste 2 large eggs, beaten 1 ½ cups panko bread crumbs cooking spray Directions Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Prepare sauce: Whisk ketchup, soy sauce, brown sugar, sherry, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic together in a bowl until sugar has dissolved. Set katsu sauce aside. Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, lay chicken pieces on a clean work surface. Season with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place beaten eggs in a flat dish or shallow bowl. Pour bread crumbs into a second flat dish. Dredge chicken pieces in egg and then in bread crumbs. Repeat by dredging chicken in egg and then bread crumbs again, pressing down so the bread crumbs stick to the chicken. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place chicken pieces in the basket of the preheated air fryer. Spray the tops with nonstick cooking spray. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Air fry for 10 minutes. Flip chicken pieces over using a spatula and spray the tops with nonstick cooking spray. Cook for 8 minutes more. Transfer chicken to a cutting board and slice. Serve with katsu sauce. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve with katsu sauce and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Editor's Note: Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of breading ingredients. The actual amount of breading consumed will vary. I Made It Print 45 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 318 Calories 7g Fat 41g Carbs 32g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 318 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 9% Saturated Fat 2g 10% Cholesterol 158mg 53% Sodium 1164mg 51% Total Carbohydrate 41g 15% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 11g Protein 32g 64% Vitamin C 5mg 6% Calcium 39mg 3% Iron 2mg 10% Potassium 392mg 8% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Air Fryer Chicken Katsu with Homemade Katsu Sauce 01 of 07 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 07 Photo by  ftcake 07/03/2023 This is an easy dinner and also in the comfort food category in my opinion. Made some Vermont curry, jasmine rice, and a Japanese cabbage salad to go along with it. 03 of 07 Photo by  JovialKelp7711 05/08/2023 I really liked the recipe as a base. The preparation and cooking of the chicken was great. I tried both the single and the double dip into the egg and breadcrumbs, but I did oven cook the chicken as well as air fry, just to make sure it was cooked.For the sauce I added curry powder for more of a curry flavour. 04 of 07 Photo by  Celeste Andrews 06/22/2020 05 of 07 Photo by  sumermeyer 04/09/2020 Super easy and delicious recipe! I ended up air frying at 400 for 20 minutes, flipping half way. I needed the extra time and temperature to get the browning. 06 of 07 Photo by  dmgiles27 03/15/2020 This is absolutely delicious!!!! Family enjoyed it as well. I'll definitely be making this again. And it was made in the air fryer. 07 of 07 Photo by  Soup Loving Nicole 02/11/2020 1 You’ll Also Love Air Fryer Korean Fried Chicken 2 Ratings Air Fryer Chicken Katsu 7 Ratings Air Fryer Coconut Chicken 16 Ratings Air Fryer Apricot-Glazed Chicken Breasts 15 Ratings Kid-Friendly Chicken Katsu Air Fryer Chicken Kiev 6 Ratings Karaage (Japanese Fried Chicken) with Honey Mayoster Sauce 6 Ratings Chicken Karaage (Japanese Fried Chicken) 11 Ratings Crispy Keto Fried Chicken in the Air Fryer 1 Rating Air Fryer Stuffed Chicken Breasts 2 Ratings Karaage Chicken Air Fryer Cornflake Chicken 1 Rating Japanese-Style Deep Fried Chicken 77 Ratings Amazing Buttermilk Air-Fried Chicken 16 Ratings Air Fryer Chicken Thigh Schnitzel 17 Ratings Air Fryer Bang-Bang Chicken 36 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
